measured_by: 2-alternative forced-choice adaptive staircase contrast discrimination task
justification: "Each participant's absolute threshold for perception (75% correct) was determined using a 2 alternative forced-choice perceptual discrimination task… The level of contrast… was determined by two adaptive staircases… which allowed determinations of the absolute perceptual threshold."

measured_by: Signal Detection Theory calculation of hit and false-alarm rates
justification: "We investigated perceptual decision making by utilizing the two measures based on signal detection theory… In the present study, perceptual sensitivity (d') is an index of a participant's ability to distinguish between the spider and crab stimuli."

measured_by: Signal Detection Theory calculation of decision criterion
justification: "The second SDT measure, criterion shift, quantifies the position of the decision criterion, which can indicate a more liberal or conservative decision bias."

measured_by: Drift Diffusion Model parameter estimated via Hierarchical Drift Diffusion Modeling
justification: "This accumulation of evidence starts from a starting point denoted as z… DDM was fitted to the choice and RT data… our main objective was to investigate whether spider and crab cues would impact z."

measured_by: Drift Diffusion Model parameter estimated via Hierarchical Drift Diffusion Modeling
justification: "The rate at which evidence accumulates is indexed by the drift rate, v… we employed hierarchical drift diffusion modeling… to investigate the influence of spider and crab cues on decision-making components."
